title: SOS (Rihanna song)
summary: "SOS" is a song by Barbadian singer Rihanna from her second studio album, A Girl like Me (2006). It was written by J. R. Rotem and E. Kidd Bogart with credit also assigned to Ed Cobb since the song is built around a sample of Soft Cell's 1981 recording of "Tainted Love", a song written by Cobb in 1965. Production of the  dance and dance-pop song was handled by Rotem. It was released on February 13, 2006, as the lead single from the album. Critical reception of "SOS" was generally positive, with the majority of music critics praising the inclusion of the "Tainted Love" sample. Some critics compared "SOS" to Rihanna's debut single, "Pon de Replay".
